intro: Corydalis pauciflora var. holanschanica, commonly known as the Sichuan corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has slender, ascending stems and produces small, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
